segments.speaker: IELTS_Examiner
segments.text: Test 3. This is the IELTS listening test. You will hear a number of different recordings and you will have to answer questions on what you hear. There will be time for you to read the instructions and questions and you will have a chance to check your work. All the recordings will be played once only. The test is in four parts. At the end of the test, you will be given 10 minutes to transfer your answers to an answer sheet. Now turn to part one. Part one. You will hear a man talking to the coordinator of a photography club. First you have some time to look at questions one to four. Now listen carefully and answer questions one to four.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: Hello, Wayside Camera Club. Brida speaking.

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Oh, hello. My name's Dan and I'd like to join your club.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: That's great, Dan. We have an application form. Would you like to complete it over the phone? Then you can ask any questions you might have.

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Oh, yes, thanks.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: OK. So what's your family name?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: It's green. Dan Green.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: So, can I take your email address?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Yes, it's dan1068 at market.com.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: Thanks. And what about your home address?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Well, I'm about ten miles away from your club in Peacetown. I live in a house there.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: OK. So, what's the house number and street?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: It's 52 Marrowfield Street.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: Is that M-A-R-R-O-W-F-I-E-L-D?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: That's right.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: And that's Peacetown, you said?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Uh-huh.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: So how did you hear about our club? Did you look on the internet?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: I usually do that, but this time... Well, I was talking to a relative the other day and he suggested it.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: Oh, is he a member too?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: He belongs to another club, but he'd heard good things about yours.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: OK. So what do you hope to get from joining?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Well, one thing that really interests me is the competitions that you have. I enjoy entering those.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: Right. Anything else?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Well, I also like to socialise with other photographers.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: That's great. So what type of membership would you like?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: What are the options?

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: It's £30 a year for full membership or £20 a year if you're an associate.

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: I think I'll go for the full membership then.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: That's a good idea because you can't vote in meetings with an associate membership.

segments.speaker: IELTS_Examiner
segments.text: Before you hear the rest of the conversation, you have some time to look at questions 5 to 10. Now listen and answer questions 5 to 10.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: If I could just find out a bit more about you.

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: OK.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: So you said you wanted to compete. Have you ever won any photography competitions?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Not yet, but I have entered three in the past.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: Oh, that's interesting. So why don't you tell me something about those? Let's start with the first one.

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Well, the theme was entitled Domestic Life.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: I see. So it had to be something related to the home?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Yeah. I chose to take a photo of a family sitting round the dinner table having a meal. And I didn't win, but I did get some feedback.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: Oh, what did the judges say?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: that it was too busy as a picture.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: Aha. So it was the composition of the picture that they criticised?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: That's right. And once they'd told me that, I could see my mistake.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: So what was the theme of the second composition?

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Well, my university was on the coast and that area gets a lot of beautiful sunsets. So that was the theme.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: Oh, sunsets. That's a great theme.

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Yes, the instructions were to capture the clouds as well. It couldn't just be blue sky and a setting sun.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: Sure, because they give you all those amazing pinks and purples.

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Yeah, and I thought I'd done that well, but the feedback was that I should have waited a bit longer to get the shot.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: I see. So the timing wasn't right.

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Yes, I took it too soon, basically. And then the third competition I entered was called Animal Magic.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: Well, that's a difficult subject.

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: I know. I had to take hundreds of shots.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: I'm sure, because animals move all the time.

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: That's what we had to show. There had to be some movement in the scene. I got a great shot of a fox in the end, but I took it at night and, well, I suspected that it was a bit dark, which is what I was told.

segments.speaker: Club_Coordinator
segments.text: Well, Dan, you seem to be really keen and we'd be delighted to have you in our club. I'm sure we can help with all those areas that you've outlined.

segments.speaker: New_Member
segments.text: Thanks, that's great.

segments.speaker: IELTS_Examiner
segments.text: That is the end of part one. You now have one minute to check your answers to part one.
